description.narrative: 'The Hinges for Children Project has been implemented in Ho Chi Minh City, where the number of children in special circumstances and the number of social assistance institutions is among the highest in Vietnam. By the end of 2019, the city has more than4,000 children being nurtured and supported at 75 social assistance centers (public sector, non-public sector, centers for social protection, social work centers, shelters, charity schools, etc). The purpose of this project is to contribute to the improvement of the legal system related to the rights and the implementation of children's rights in terms of supporting education, vocational training, and job opportunities for disadvantaged children living at social assistance centers. In general, the operation of those types of centershad a relatively specific legal status, such as Decree 136/2013 / ND-CP on social assistance policies for social protection beneficiaries, The 2016 Law on Children and Decree 56/2017 / ND-CP guiding the implementation of mentioned law and Decree 103/2017 / ND-CP on the establishment, operation, dissolution, and management social assistance centers. However, in reality, these documents and regulations still limit specific provisions related to the roles and responsibilities ofthe parties after children leave the social assistance centers. The key activities of this project include: - Raising awareness of rights and how to implement rights in accordancewith policies to support education, vocational training, and job opportunities for disadvantaged children living at social assistance centers. - Supporting the settlement of administrative regulations and procedures that have limited children's rights in terms ofeducation, vocational training, and job opportunities. - Reviewing and proposing policy adjustments related to the roles and responsibilities of stakeholders for supporting education, vocational training, and job opportunities, thereby helping to prepare the bestconditions for children after leaving social assistance centers.

participating-org.narrative: '' HCM Association for Protection of Child Rights was established in 2014. Currently the Association has 15 chapters with nearly 400 members, supporting women and children, particularly providing them with legal aid, is the thematic focus of the Association Some keynote activities of the Association are as follows: - Organize at least 35-40 moot courses, 40-60 training and communication classes in the community to promote legal education and raise awareness for children and people about relevant issuesand areas related tothe protection of the rights of women and children. - Provide children with legal presentation of the children in court to ensure their legitimate rights and interests. - Cooperating with UINICEF in different activities to build a child-friendly city model in city areas.
